name: string
description: This library provides generic functions for string manipulation, such as finding and extracting substrings, and pattern matching. When indexing a string in Lua, the first character is at position 1 (not at 0, as in C). Indices are allowed to be negative and are interpreted as indexing backwards, from the end of the string. Thus, the last character is at position -1, and so on.

functions.name: byte
functions.description: Returns the internal numeric codes of the characters s[start_pos], s[start_pos + 1], ..., s[end_pos]

parameters.name: start_pos
parameters.description: The first character of the string to get the byte of

parameters.name: end_pos
parameters.description: The last character of the string to get the byte of

functions.name: char
functions.description: Receives zero or more integers. Returns a string with length equal to the number of arguments, in which each character has the internal numeric code equal to its corresponding argument

parameters.name: haystack
parameters.description: The string to search in.

parameters.name: needle
parameters.description: The string to find, can contain patterns if enabled.

parameters.name: startPos
parameters.description: The position to start the search from, can be negative start position will be relative to the end position.

parameters.name: noPatterns
parameters.description: Disable patterns.

functions.name: find
functions.description: Looks for the first match of `pattern` in the string.

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: The string to convert.

parameters.name: repetitions
parameters.description: Timer to repeat, this values gets rounded internally.

parameters.name: separator
parameters.description: String that will separate the repeated piece. Notice that it doesn't add this string to the start or the end of the result, only between the repeated parts.

functions.name: rep
functions.description: Returns a string that is the concatenation of `n` copies of the string `s` separated by the string `sep`.

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: The string to convert.

functions.name: lower
functions.description: Returns a copy of this string with all uppercase letters changed to lowercase.

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: The string to convert.

functions.name: upper
functions.description: Returns a copy of this string with all lowercase letters changed to uppercase.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: The function to get the bytecode of

parameters.name: stripDebugInfo
parameters.description: True to strip the debug data, false to keep it

functions.name: dump
functions.description: Returns a string containing a binary representation (a *binary chunk*) of the given function.

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: String which should be searched in for matches.

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: The pattern that defines what should be matched.

parameters.name: startPosition
parameters.description: The start index to start the matching from, can be negative to start the match from a position relative to the end.

functions.name: match
functions.description: Looks for the first match of `pattern` in the string.

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: The string to be reversed.

functions.name: reverse
functions.description: Returns a string that is the string `s` reversed.

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: The string you'll take a sub-string out of.

parameters.name: StartPos
parameters.description: The position of the first character that will be included in the sub-string.

parameters.name: EndPos
parameters.description: The position of the last character to be included in the sub-string. It can be negative to count from the end.

functions.name: sub
functions.description: Returns the substring of the string that starts at `i` and continues until `j`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The string to search in

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: The pattern to search for

functions.name: gmatch
functions.description: Returns an iterator function that, each time it is called, returns the next captures from `pattern` over the string s.

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: The string to find the length of.

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: String which should be modified.

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: The pattern that defines what should be matched and eventually be replaced.

parameters.name: replacement
parameters.description: In case of a string the matched sequence will be replaced with it. In case of a table, the matched sequence will be used as key and the table will tested for the key, if a value exists it will be used as replacement.  In case of a function all matches will be passed as parameters to the function, the return value(s) of the function will then be used as replacement.

parameters.name: maxReplaces
parameters.description: Maximum number of replacements to be made.

functions.name: gsub
functions.description: Returns a copy of s in which all (or the first `n`, if given) occurrences of the `pattern` have been replaced by a replacement string specified by `repl`.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The string to be formatted

parameters.name: formatParameters
parameters.description: Values to be formatted into the string.

functions.name: format
functions.description: Returns a formatted version of its variable number of arguments following the description given in its first argument.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The string to be formatted

parameters.name: formatParameters
parameters.description: Values to be formatted into the string.

functions.name: format
functions.description: Returns a formatted version of its variable number of arguments following the description given in its first argument.
